review: Giving 3 stars because the waiters and staff are extremely friendly! The place is always clean and the food comes out quickly, a little too quickly like if it was pre cooked or they are giving it to you under cooked, in my case the food was undercooked and not like it is at other chili's in the area

Ordered iced tea.  11 minutes later, asked for a menu.  12 minutes later, asked what I want.   Burger.   It has now been 17 minutes. No ice in my tea.  No burger.  The restaurant is 1/4 full. And... I am at the BAR. Such a travesty of a Chili's.   Tried this one again.. stupidly.. 19 minutes now... no burger.  No ice.  Being ignored.

I only come here because it's close to my house (very unfortunate) I can't remember the last time I received good service... I guess you minus well call me a masochist.  Today I ordered a medium 6oz stake, what I got was a raw piece of meat!!! I keep telling myself I won't come back to this place EVER AGAIN!! But I honestly come here just for the convenience of distance.
I mean a guy was murdered inside here in April so that's all you need to know....Google it

Visited this location recently for lunch and I must say I had a very good experience. I ordered the half slab of ribs with street corn and they were both surprisingly good . The chicken quesadilla soup was as I expected and probably one of the better soups I've ever had . On my visit I was with my 2 year old daughter and everyone was extremely accommodating and I received constant service . Good food and attentive service is all I ask for and I received it . Keep up the good work !!

After hurricane Irma my coworkers and I went to chilis to eat, I understood days after the storm there would be some issues but the service I received was subpar. We ordered sodas only to find out the fountain soda were out so we had to pay for individual cans, something I feel the waitress should've mentioned upon ordering. My order margarita chicken and broccoli took an hour to some out, by the time I received my order everyone from my party had already finished their meal, but to make matters worst the broccoli had black spots over it ( not black pepper) so I mentioned it to the waitress and ask her if I could have my bill adjusted. She acted as if I was being unreasonable and I ask her would she eat this broccoli and her response was "I don't eat here". If a waitress at a restaurant refused to eat the food she's serving, that says a lot about the quality of service/food at this establishment. This will prob be my last time supporting this particular chilis establishment!

So I am visiting from D.C. And my family members brought me here to have a few drinks. I have honestly never been this upset about service. It took about 30 minutes for the server to get to us... and the serve was just s....l......o.....w......  we only ordered drinks, chips and salsa, and two appetizers for a party of four, and had to wait about 20 minutes in between each time we asked for something. They ran out of napkins, and the restrooms were also out of the necessary products (per the people I visited with). Our server was unapologetic, and it just seemed like maybe they weren't working towards tips?? Luckily my sister accompanied us, because she got up to get napkins, straws, and almost beat the server to our drinks at the bar because they were sitting there for about 10 minutes.  I hate to be b*tch about about it, and maybe I'm just used to the service up north. I don't know how people go to an establishment like this.  I hope the manager reads this, because I'm not from here but someone else may benefit from better service.

My favorite go-to restaurant that's good on prices and flavor. My favorite deal is the 3 for $10. You get an appetizer, an entree of your choice from a list they provide you with, AND a dessert! Waiters are really nice, but because it gets busy quickly, they can get a little distracted sometimes. Just make sure to put your cup at the end of the table if you're ready for a refill. You won't even notice that they've looked at it when they're coming around with your next drink. Overall a good spot.

This place gave me the worst service I have ever had in my entire life, anywhere, at any restaurant - ever.  I have honestly contemplated calling corporate to complain about how terrible the service was here. Me and my girlfriend sat in the bar area and we waited for 20 MINUTES and no server came to our table to even ask us what we wanted to drink. That was strike 1. Then we went to the hostess stand ( where there was NO hostess) and waited for like 5 minutes. We were starving so decided to seat ourselves in another section. We sit in a section were there was obviously a server, and still another 10 minutes and nobody comes up to the table. They basically did not want our business. I went up to the manager and he was extremely unhelpful. He seemed annoyed by my complaint that we had been in this establishment for 30 minutes, switched tables, and still nobody asked us what we wanted to drink.  When I tell you I am talking to this man and he is barely even looking at me or acknowledging my existence, I am serious. I could not believe this was the manager. When we FINALLY got a server she was weird and gave us an attitude and said "I was coming to you" with this passive aggressive smile. We ordered asparagus fries. God awful. I write these harsh reviews because I feel bad for the owners who let other people run their business and then wonder why they are going bankrupt. The entire staff in this place needs to be fired and replaced.

Meh. This Chili's is below the usual Chili's. The staff are not exactly pleasant. And they are definitely inattentive. My first time here, I waited over 15 mins. before being handed a menu or even slightly greeted. I sat there and watched as three staff fiddled with the computer system right in front of me as I sat at the bar. The food here also takes an incredibly long time to come out. So definitely don't come here if you want a quick-ish meal.

Waste of time - I am giving them  1 start just to write this review. Sat for 15 minutes without being approached by any staff member. Gentlemen  next to me complaining that it took  forever to get his meal. That's was our indicator  to abandon our seat.

I decided to come to this Chili's for a quick eat with my boyfriend at 1 o'clock. It wasn't busy so I got sat immediately but our server (Renecca) took about 10-15 minutes to greet us. Took her an even longer time taking our order. When we finally got our food is was cold, like c'mon now really? Thankfully, it was time molten cake! It didn't taste like the original at all and the ice cream had freezer burn. Now I had to speak with a manager. After hearing all that his words were "my job is not to apologize, but it happened" WHAT?! We left at 3 o'clock; two hours later for two entrees and a dessert. At least it wasn't filthy.

Wow! I can't believe that I waited 5 minutes to get a table just so that the entire wait staff can ignore me. They all just walked by us for 15 minutes avoiding our eye contact. No one to take our drink orders,  no water, no acknowledgment, its as if we where not even siting there. The server taking care of the table in front of us was way to busy talking about how over whelmed with tables he was and how upset he was about that to the very table he was taking care of. All other servers seem to be having a terrible time at work as well because they all had a terrible attitude. So I found the host and let her know we where going. I am always so taken back when I get bad service. I get awesome service 99% of the time. So now I am at the Aventura Chiles waiting to eat and drinking my sad experience away.

Came here after church for lunch and I don't think I too much like this Chili's location but my fiance claims it's better than the one in Aventura.......NOT TO ME........This is not the first time that I came here and they always seem to take time to seat you. When we finally got seated our waitress came and she was great. I hate that I can't remember her name but she was truly pleasant and attentive to our needs and made sure our drinks were filled and we were ok with everything we ordered. NOW........THE FOOD....... they either need a new cook or they're just slapping things from microwave to plate for you without making sure the food is hot. The steak was ok but my loaded mash looked stiff. The cheese didn't even melt on the mash and the bacon looked like bacon bits that they bought from the gas station.  Next time I'll drive past this Chili's to the one out of my way in Aventura. Find another location......not this one!
Great experience. Camryn was our waitress and she was friendly and attentive. The food was good and i honestly don't have any complaints.

The waitress was on vacation the whole time she would disappear for extended periods of time leaving us with no refills and the restaurant wasn't even packed when my family and I got there. However the food was memorable but I expected that since I LOVE the Chicken Cajun Pasta. I usually get the same entree most of the time when I go done here. It was HOT and moist and quite delicious the garlic toast was just crisp enough but not tooth breaking or crusty. We simply wanted to go celebrate and eat after my nephew dedication last Sunday I wish service had been as delightful as my dish though I want crazy about the appetizer and how come the spinach and artichoke has been completely removed from the menu that used to be my absolute favorite must have COME ON PEOPLE lol.
Service very slow , server had no emotion just a dry hi , drink were good and food ok but restaurant was dirty
Worst service on a Friday night ! I was sitting down waiting for 20 mins, I asked a waiter to take my order! He told me "I'm not you're waiter" not even a sorry I'll get him. Not coming again!
I just find it pretty funny that I call Chilis at 1130 and they tell me i can't order Togo when they close at 12.

Co-workers suggested this spot; we are new to neighborhood, so I took a chance..I gambled and lost!!  First issue, asked for the new Fresco salad, waitress brought me the house salad with two side dressings.  House salad looked tasty, I accepted it - sometimes things happen.  Entree order - chicken tacos "Miss, please, do not place avocados on the tacos..I am allergic to tacos."  Order of tacos placed on my table, server says "Taco - no avocado." Took one bite, right into an avocado.  Allergic reaction begins, as well, as some strange human reactions from manager and waitress that do not represent proper service etiquette or manager responsibility.    I don't know what happened next because I had to run out of restaurant to the nearby CVS to avoid a significant allergic reaction.  My entire day was ruined as I attempted to control the itching and queasiness of my belly.  Finally, my body rejected the entire lunch and I was left to drink benedryl and drink black tea all day.   I gambled and I LOST.

The place is awful...quick review: -brought an allergen in meal despite the clear, specific request not to include it...sadly the manager was the one who made the mistake -waitress apologized...nothing but questions from the manager...event when the affected patron left to hunt down Benadryl to calm the reaction to their mistake  -my medium rare sirloin was purple...RAW and chewy....manager comped it...but charged for the rest of the meal  Never...going....back

Don't walk but RUN away! This place needs a WHOLE make over. The place has a smell about it and the employees I came across need to get out the customer service field..... I cant comment about the food because we WERENT SEATED or Greeted. They weren't busy and I we weren't the only ones to walk out. Don't waste your time.

I like a server to take care of me, not a computer. You get seated and a "server?" brings you a little computer to place your order on. I tell him "I don't want to use that. I want you to take care of us". He says OK and I think I am going to get the good service I am used to at Chili's. After too long, he returns and takes our orders. Drinks come out in good time but not the meals. Finally, my wife's hamburger comes out but 5 minutes before my enchiladas (not good). The food is just OK but the service sucks. Had to flag down a guy to get refills. Having the little computers probably allows Chili's to cut back on servers. When I go to a "sit down" restaurant, I want to be taken care of by "my server".  Not just a delivery person.

Okaaaaaaay! So, I went to chili's last night. I was having such an awesome time, I didn't write a review. Well here goes... It was rather crowded at the bar, but a good kind of crowded. I always go with a group of people I know from Facebook and we always turn the place out. The bartenders know us and the waitresses are very attentive to us as well. For a crowded place (due to the sports games), it didn't even take an unusually long time to get our drinks and food. They even separated the tab for us. Unlike a lot of other restaurants that doesn't like to separate the bill when there's a large party. The vibe was nice, the food was fresh and CORRECT as we ordered, and my favorite team won the game. What more could you ask for?! The restroom was pretty clean and the manager even came over to check on us. Made us feel important lol..  Awesome spot for a weekday or weekend. Very laid back! I love it.
The people  is nice but the food was cold ..I saw people  sending there food back and I still gave them the benefit of the doubt the food was cold and terrible I will never visit that place again

Not sure how Chipotle Chicken Crispers sounds like Chipotle Chicken Pizza, but anyway, I'm not complaining about the food. It was decent bar food. It filled my belly, and the BBQ sauce for the fries was nicely smoky. My complaint is related to the service. In addition to the food order mix up need above, my delayed soda refill was regular iced tea instead of the blackberry iced tea that I asked for. Also, the restaurant didn't seem that packed when my friend and I were there yet our order appeared to take awhile. Is chili's taking part in the slow food movement?
It was fairly packs but not too packed. Seated right away. Nice people. Very loud though. The music was also super loud. Clean and good food.
The wait is terrible, my food was cold when it finally arrived. The waiter didn't have a great attitude either.

Hands down, the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. EVER. They could have shit in my food and I would have had a better experience. I should have listened to all the warning signs not to come here but my gf was so persistent on eating Chilis that we decided to go to the closest one. Where do I begin, first we waited 30 minutes to be seated, which was expected in a weekend. Once we sat down, our waiter did not arrive to our table for a little over 20 minutes. Following those 20 minutes, the waiter did not bring my drink (and there were three of us) for about another 20 minutes, which he spilled in my brand new pair of Air Yeezys.  That alone was enough to piss me off. My sons food arrived first, 40 minutes later, our food arrives. And if u know kids after they are done eating, they get restless. When I get my food, half of what I ordered was missing. The waiter tells me "they ran out of egg rolls when I went to grab ur food." Why wasn't I informed about this so I could make a decision on whether I still wanted it or not? My food came with 2 sliders, the guy put both sliders on a regular burger bun and tells me that they ran out of mini burger buns. Wtf. Again, why wasn't I informed? Btw, I'm still sitting in the restaurant and I have an empty drink that has never been refilled. Worse experience ever. Avoid this restaurant at all cost. If reviews had negative stars, I would give this restaurant -100 stars.

I will give this place 2 stars because of the amazing waiter I had but other than him this place fails to impress. My plates for my main course and dessert were filthy. I mean, you could see the grime and filth around the plate. It looks as if it was dipped in hot water and wiped with no soap. The ribs were not good at all. I'm not a chef and I could probably cook better ribs with my eyes closed. The sauce on the ribs tasted like sweet ketchup. I will not be back to this location in Miami Gardens. The Chillis by my house in miramar is 10 times better. Service A+ Food D-  the guacamole withy appetizer was good. That's about it.

Why are they still open? Bad service and  bad attitudes.  I went to use the restroom and there was no toilet paper. So why does this woman have an attitude about putting toilet paper in the bathroom? So I mentioned it to the manager and she moved lol.  Now my drink came out looking like froth. Then my order was wrong and it took forever to be corrected. Just horrible all around

We got to the restaurant at 8:05pm we didn't get our food until 9:03. They were extremely under staff and the host said "it'll be a 15 minute wait" that turned into 30 mins. No utensils on the table and the food was salty.

This has to be one of the worst Chili's in South Florida. The last time i went the waitress i had forgot my son's order multiple times. She only checked on us once. Which was to take our food and drink order. Majority of the time i had to ask other waitresses/Waiters to grab her or i had to flag her down. SMH AVOID THIS PLACE

They do not provide the free chips and salsa. And we ordered the trio fajita for 2 people and got 3 fajitas and 1 mini scoop of sour cream, guacamole, and tomato ( more like for 1 person). We will not be coming back to chilis

Ok so this chili's has really gone down hill but being that it's the closest in my area I still tend to go. In my opinion the best time is after 6pm and even though I stop drinking my husband and I prefer to sit ONLY at the bar if there's no room were not staying. why? for some reason sitting at the table nothing seems to go right or fast enough. As I mentioned before I'm no longer a drinker BUT if you are Arline and Yati are the best bartenders and in that order. Hope this was helpful

Still sitting worst service I have ever had sat 10 minutes before someone came to my table then our server took our drink order and food at the same time still don't know her name never came to check on me and my family I would never come back and wound not  recommend anyone to come here it is now 7:41 11/11/15

went in for take out on a Saturday night.. The guy said my order was going to take 15 mins but I ended leaving 1hr later. why? The first time my oder came out (30mins) it was wrong. they gave me someone else's order and thank God I checked. I waited another 30 mins and my order finally came. I got home opened my container, the food was there but when I opned my husband's container his fries were missing...Called the restaurant and waited 20-30 minutes to speak with the manager...I will never go back to this chillis for take out. for all the time I spent there I could have dined in.  PS: One more thing. I wouldnt order ribs from from there. while I was at the take out counter I saw the guy doing the ribs the back. and he was just flipping the ribs over with his hands to put the sauce on it. saw him grab something else (that was not food) and proceeded to flip ribs again with the same hand.....smh.

I just had the baby back ribs with the Dr. Pepper BBQ sauce. I also had a side of the Rahr & Sons Craft Beer BBQ Sauce. It was excellent the Dr Pepper bbq sauce taste just like Dr Pepper and the Rahr & Sons taste just like beer. I love those new sauces. They taste delectable!!! The jalapeño corn bread is awesome.

Just called to place a pick up order for 8pm she said that she can't take my order because they close at 9pm! I been working as a manger in the restaurant business and can't understand where the problem is to pick up my food 1 hour before they close!!!?!??? I just placed a order without any kinda problems ! Thanks chillis !!! :( no stars for the costumer service !!!!!!
I don't know why I don't just learn my lesson and  just order a h burger. I had the toughest sirloin ever!

This area needed a decent chain restaurant.  I swear, there only lunchtime work option was fast food.  Located at the corner of Ives Dairy & 441, this is convenient.  And the food is on par for any decent Chili's.  Love the sliders. Love the molten lava cake. They have salad combos, but I'll admit, when I go to Chili's, I'm usually a bad girl.

I've been to this Chili's several times to celebrate different birthdays and the service and food have always been great. The staff is very friendly and always accommodating. The parking gets packed in that shopping center so that's a bit of a turn off.

A-Ok from me.  We were greeted by a lackadaisical, surly hostess lacking any social skills who seated us without a smile and when asked if they had a kiddie menu simply stated "NO" and meandered off... [minus one star right there]  Well...OKAY THEN!...  But then she was redeemed by a wonderful server by the name of JUAN who proceeded to make the whole dining experience a whole lot nicer. Telling us with a sense of fun in his attitude of wonderfulness such as two for one beers and house margaritas, and a verbal run down of the kids menu which they had simply run out of the paper copies of and we were back on track.  Nobody was mad hungry but we needed some sort of dinner coming from a failed attempt at making the Transformer's movie at Aventura Mall and the subsequent trek around the mall to hit up Brookstones and the games stores...so the kids opted for MacNCheese and Burger and maw went for the special they had, two buffalo chicken sliders and paw went for the Fajita chicken.  The food was fast, the drinks came out fast and Juan was on top of his game.  The place was busy, they had the games on tv and it was a good night after all.

The food was not bad at all.  I actually enjoyed the food when it came out.  I ordered one of my favorite dishes...yes, the Fajitas.  The flavor was good and the food was great.  The only reason I have to give this restaurant two stars instead of three is because the waitresses that we had (as sweet as they were) kept forgetting the drinks.  It took the first waitress awhile to bring out the initial order of drinks.  She took the order and then started talking to other waitresses.  I even noticed that she pulled out her cell phone and started talking on the phone . I eventually asked the manager to bring a cup of water for my five year old.  He brought it right away.  Our drinks came out after that.  By the time we were about 1/2 way done with our meal another waitress took over our table because the first waitress had to go home.  She asked could she refill our drinks. She took my cup and totally forgot to come back with it.  She also started socializing with other waiters/waitresses.  So...as good as the food was, I have to give two stars because socializing interfered with quality service.
I'm pretty sure this place takes pride in their ability to mess up any order that you place. Quesadillas are supposed to have cheese in then, correct?

UPSET ENOUGH TO WRITE TO CHILI'S CORPORATE FOR THIS EXPERIENCE: i love chilis.  but i hate this location.  i've tried several times but this last time, i'm convinced it's this particular location.  i went there for a late dinner with my husband.  i ordered the bacon ranch quesadillas and suggested we share since it's such a huge portion.  not!!!  i'm convinced this location uses a smaller tortilla because the other chilis i go to, i can never even finish this meal and this one looked muuuuch smaller.  also, they didn't have the chipotle? (orange colored) ranch dressing that comes with the bacon raaaaaanch quesadilla.  what?!?!?   we were still hungry so we decided to order wings, one of my favorite things from chilis.  the wings were mushy and not crispy.  some of them were not even fully cooked through.   i wanted desert and figured that they could not mess that up.  i was wrong again.  my chocolate molten came out and did not have that crispy shell over the ice cream.  there was some runny chocolate syrup spread over the ice cream but definitely not a shell.   i am never ever ever coming back to this location.  something is wrong with the kitchen there.  someone needs to check it out for sure.  service was fine but the food sucks!!!
Its about that hr ...... You know happy hr.... More like happy all day two for ones and the bartender here is great. She's fast and efficient can beat that the cooks just have to step up there game.
I give this place four stars...why you ask?? Because the place keeps a nice crowd the food had always been acceptable and what matters the most...it's always happy hour two for one all day!
crystal is amazing,  super service.  please ask for her, tell her justice sent you. ...

I've been to this Chili's location many times with my family and my grandmother. There where 5 people in my party and waitress was nice on this visit. We had 4 appetizers (Texas Cheese Fries, Salsa and Chips, Wings Over Buffalo, and 4 Ceaser Salads). I had the Chipotle original chicken with french fries, wasn't able to finish it because I was full from the appetizers. The drinks are good as I had the strawberry lemonade. The service was good overall as I rate 4 stars for this review.
Good place to drink and have appetizer the food sucks I only go to watch games or have a drink food comes out pretty fast
Consistently stale food from this place. Nasty stale fries, stale chicken crispers, etc. the Aventura location, while average, is way better. Not coming here again.

The service is a bit on the slow side, and the people are less than friendly, but still one of the better places to eat when I'm at work. The food is the normal Chili's food, which is fine, it's kind of nice to know what to expect. If you are planning for a quick lunch call in your order and save lots of time.

horrible location!!! i will never go here again, mess up orders constantly! take forever to do everything. to go is never on time, they always forget stuff, the managers don't care. they did not have the common sense to use my phone number i provided for a pick up when they ran out of items, they just waited till i arrived to tell me! i walked out! for the last time too. the manager did not give a care in the world!

I frequent this Chilis often and here are some tips: sit at the bar. Dining service is terrible. I can be semi-impatient about being greeted so for faster service sit at the bar! I almost always get the mojito with the triple dipper. Double SW eggrolls and wings over buffalo. Great chill spot.
The food is OK; pretty much the same as every other Chilis. However, the service is awful. I purposely drive a little farther to go to a different Chilis to avoid the terrible service...

Chili's is one of my favorite restaurants but this location sucks. I came to this location once and never again. The only good thing is I didn't get ID when ordering drinks but aside from that they took forever to even ask if we wanted to start off with some water and the food was cold and took long to bring out. I wasn't even agknowledged as I walk thru the door. I'll stick to my chili's in aventura

The food is ok. I live 2 mins from this location,and I rather walk to the next one. There customer services keeps me away from this location.  If you only like to see your waitor twice wile you dine,once for the order and once for the check, then this is the spot for you. I dont want to wait twenty mins for a refill.

It took 10 minutes to get a waiter to take our order.  It then took 10-15 minutes for the waiter to bring our drinks.  Our food came in a decent amount of time.  The food was not bad.  I ordered salmon.  The salmon was editable but maybe a day old.  The rice was very good.  The drinks that were ordered at the table were made well. In addition, they have a cool mural that was amazing to view.  The staff was whatever. The end.

this place is horrible and most of all very ghetto! i ordered a california club no! avacado, instead of the waitress listenting to my order she (sheila ) gave me an avacado burger, (and through my food at me as she was talking to a co-worker), mind you i ordered this to go! there is nothing worse than getting home and realizing you didnt get the right order. when i drove back to get my money back ghetto sheila decided to laugh at the disgust on my face. i got no real help from the managers, i have yet to get the money put back on my credit card for my order, not to mention how stink the floors smelled from the liquor that had yet to be cleaned behind the bar, and the rude service here. i would never recommend this location to anyone!
